quiz.title: Real World Graphs
quiz.subtitle: Unit 3.9: Applying Graph Analysis to Practical Situations
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Interpreting Graphs in Context, Applied Scenarios

questions.question: This graph shows a car's distance from home over time. What does the horizontal segment represent?
options: The car is driving at constant speed
questions.explanation: On a distance-time graph, a horizontal line means distance isn't changing, so the car is stopped.

questions.question: The graph shows temperature in an oven during baking. What happens at the point labeled 'P'?
options: The oven reaches and maintains set temperature
The oven is turned off instantly
questions.explanation: At point P, the temperature stops rising and becomes constant, indicating the oven has reached its set temperature.

questions.question: This graph shows a company's profits over 5 years. During which year did profits decrease?
questions.explanation: The graph goes downward from Year 2 to Year 3, indicating decreasing profits.

questions.question: The graph shows water level in a bathtub over time. When was water being added fastest?
questions.explanation: The steepest upward slope occurs in the first 2 minutes, indicating fastest filling rate.

questions.question: This graph shows a person's height from birth to age 18. What is true about ages 2-12?
questions.explanation: The graph shows a straight line from ages 2-12, indicating steady, constant growth.

questions.question: The graph shows sales of winter coats by month. Why does the graph peak in November/December?
questions.explanation: November sales peak primarily due to dropping temperatures requiring winter coats. While Christmas shopping may contribute, coat sales respond more directly to weather changes than holiday timing.

questions.question: This graph shows electricity usage in a house over 24 hours. What does the spike at 7 PM represent?
options: Most people return home and use appliances
Industrial electricity demand peaks in evenings
Solar power generation drops at sunset
Evening is when most businesses operate
questions.explanation: Residential electricity spikes in early evening as people return home, cook dinner, and use lights and electronics.

questions.question: The graph shows population of a town over 50 years. What happened around year 30?
questions.explanation: The curve gets steeper after year 30, indicating faster population growth.

questions.question: This graph shows a smartphone's battery charge during use. When was it charging?
questions.explanation: Battery percentage increases between hours 4-6, indicating charging.

questions.question: The graph shows attendance at a movie theater. What does the lowest point likely represent?
questions.explanation: Lowest attendance typically occurs during early morning weekdays when most people are at work/school.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent real-world graph interpretation! You can extract meaningful insights and connect graphical features to practical situations.
scoreMessages.70: Strong applied skills! Focus on connecting slope to rates in context and interpreting plateaus/spikes meaningfully.
scoreMessages.50: Developing interpretation skills. Practice: 1) What do the axes represent in context? 2) What does slope mean here? 3) Why do patterns occur?
scoreMessages.0: Start with basic graph reading in context. For each graph, ask: What is being measured? What units? What would make this go up/down in real life?
